clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Immune Status of Patients With Severe Crohn's Disease Using Single Cell Sequencing

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: Using single cell sequencing method to evaluate and compare the immune status of patients with severe CD.

primary_outcome.measure: single cell analysis of the colonic tissue of patients with severe crohn's disease
primary_outcome.description: single cell analysis of the colonic tissue of patients with severe crohn's disease: inflammed and non-inflammed area from right colon or the terminal ileum

intervention.description: colonic tissue biospy of patients with severe crohn's disease using colonoscopy

biospec_descr.textblock: Using the biospy samples of right colon or the last segment of ileum (both inflammation area and normal area nearby of 5cm), when patients receiving colonoscopy.

study_pop.textblock: The patients were diagnosed as severe CD based on clinical, laboratory, endoscopic changes and imging.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: 1, Patients with severe CD（CDAI>16,SES-CD>19） 2, Patients have no previous any drug therapy targeting CD or just received treatment of 5-ASA - Exclusion Criteria: 1, patients have previous treatment of prednisone, immunosuppressive agents such as azathioprine and biologic agents such as infliximab 2, patients were diagnozed as mild-moderate CD 3, patients have other immune disordered diseases such as SLE, PBC, AIH, PSC, sjogren syndrome, ulcerative colitis, and so on.
